title: Tyson Fury to make WWE debut in showdown with Braun Strowman at Crown Jewel showcase in Saudi Arabia
text:
WWE have revealed that boxing star Tyson Fury will make his wrestling debut when he fights Braun Strowman at the Crown Jewel showcase on October 31.

The pair had come face to face at both Smackdown and Raw and will settle their explosive feud in Saudi Arabia at the pay-per-view event.

The announcement was made at a blockbuster press conference held in Las Vegas on Friday.

Boxing superstar Tyson Fury will make his wrestling debut when he fights Braun Strowman

Fury had been a surprise guest on last week's edition of Smackdown, and had to be restrained by security after hurling abuse towards Strowman from ringside.

The lineal world champion then appeared on Monday Night Raw to demand an apology from the wrestling giant, before the two traded blows inside the ring and were separated by a host of WWE stars.

At the press conference, Fury said: 'I was a lifelong WWE fan and it is a fantastic opportunity for me to be here. I’m so excited to be fighting the monster among men, Braun Strowman.

The Gypsy King was a surprise guest ringside last week and had to be restrained by security

'After seeing him I really know why he’s got the nickname ‘monster among men’. But me being the undefeated lineal heavyweight boxing champion, I fear no man.

'I’m undefeated in 30 professional contests and when I go to Saudi Arabia to fight Braun Strowman I’m still going to be undefeated. I’m going to knock Braun Strowman out.

'He talks about how good his hands are but he’s messing with the guy with the best hands in boxing. He don’t want none of them hands let me tell you that.’

Infamous boxing promoter Bob Arum added: 'Tyson Fury, the Gypsy King, he’s not only a great fighter, he reminds me of Muhammad Ali, George Foreman.

Strowman and Fury's newfound rivalry came to a head on Monday Night Raw with a brawl

The pair had to be separated by a host of WWE stars before Fury knocked out Cesaro off air

'He entertains in the ring and he is a tremendous personality.

'He is a real showman, and that’s why people love him. They know that he fights with his heart on his sleeve.

'And even though he had a big cut over his eye and blood streaming down his face, so he can’t really see his opponent, he carries on to victory.'

WWE also revealed that Brock Lesnar and Cain Velasquez would reignite their UFC rivalry at the same event.
